text.p: These are the headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Chretien's wisecracks overheard: Open mike picks up PM's sarcastic appraisal of U.S. politics before NATO ceremony.
- Price cut recruits young smokers: 97,000 more since taxes fell.
- Ontario to shed 6,000 workers: Transfers mean some layoffs.
- Regional rulers ignore Kremlin: Russian government cannot dictate to Primorsky's powerful governor.
- Brain scans show learning differences: Age plays role in strorage of language.
- Repap sells U.S. unit: Consolidated Papers will pay C$277 million in a deal that may help parent company survive.
- Apple shaken as CEO suddenly quits: Move tied to poor third quarter- analysts.
- Terry Hui's real estate star poised to rise to new level.
- Microsoft secretly targeting Corel's Java software threat: IDC.

- Repap in C$1.0 billion asset selloff: Deals will help keep creditors at bay in the short term but industry experts war the troubled forestry company will be left with just one major asset and an mountain of debt.
- Royal Oak mine in danger as gold price falls further.
- The Kosich plan (for Eaton's): Up go stocks, down go overheads - literally.
